text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Uberaba | native_name = | native_name_lang = pt | settlement_type = Municipality | official_name = Municipality of Uberaba | image_skyline = Skyline de Uberaba.png | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_flag = BandeiraUberaba.jpg | flag_alt = Flag | image_seal = | seal_alt = | image_shield = BrasaoUberaba.jpg | shield_alt = Coat of arms | motto = | image_map = MinasGerais Municip Uberaba.svg | map_alt = | map_caption = Location in Minas Gerais | pushpin_map = Brazil | pushpin_label_position = 250 | pushpin_map_alt = | pushpin_map_caption = Localization of Uberaba in Brazil | coor_pinpoint = | coordinates = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | subdivision_type1 = Region | subdivision_name1 = Southeast | subdivision_type2 = State | subdivision_name2 = | established_title = Founded | established_date = 2 March 1820 | seat_type = Mayor-council government | seat = | government_footnotes = | leader_party = SD | leader_title = Mayor | leader_name = Elisa Gonçalves Araujo | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_note = | area_water_percent = | area_rank = | area_blank2_title = | area_total_km2 = 4529.7 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | area_blank2_km2 = | area_total_dunam = | area_land_dunam = | area_water_dunam = | area_urban_dunam = | area_rural_dunam = | area_metro_dunam = | area_blank1_dunam = | area_blank2_dunam = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = 823 | population_footnotes = IBGE 2020 | population_total = 340,277 | population_as_of = 2021 | population_density_km2 = 71 | population_demonym = | population_note = | timezone1 = BRT | utc_offset = −3 | timezone1_DST = BRST | utc_offset1_DST = −2 | postal_code_type = Postal Code | postal_code = 38000-000 | area_code_type = | area_code = +55 34 | iso_code = | website = | blank_name = HDI (2010) | blank_info = 0.772 – high | footnotes = }} Uberaba () is a city in the state of Minas Gerais, southeast Brazil. It was founded in 1820 and the city status was granted in 1856. In 2021 about 340,277 people lived in Uberaba. The name of the city comes from the Tupi language, and means bright water. It covers an area of 4,529.7 km2 (1,748.9 sq mi). ==References== Category:Cities in Minas Gerais
title: Uberaba
